tracks.text: At twilight, a woman in a loose, black robe runs over a hill, passing a burning barrel.
She falls in the dirt, then looks up. It's Madonna, a young, round faced woman with curly brown hair.
A door shuts. Crosses burn.
In a flashback, Madonna turns and sees ruffians gathered by a wall. A blond man sees her.
Madonna rises from the dirt, looking around.
A white building stands in the twilight with glowing orange windows on its doors.
A black man walks into a spotlight with a vacant expression. A police officer holds his arms behind his back.
Madonna enters the doors with the orange windows. Her black robe slides off one shoulder, revealing a thin, red nightgown.
She looks around the room. A covered table sits on a dais, surrounded by candelabras. To the side, candles glow in front of a statue.
Madonna kneels in front of the statue. An orange light beams down from above, making her curly hair look like a halo
The statue is a black man, dressed as Jesus, wearing a long string of beads that end in a cross. He holds roses.
A tear runs down the cheek of the Black Jesus Statue
Madonna approaches the bars separating her from the statue, and kneels on a velvet stool.
She holds the bars, looks up, and sings to Jesus. Later, she lies down on a long, narrow, wooden bench.
Hands outstretched, Madonna finds herself in the sky
A smiling black woman reaches out and catches Madonna as she falls. They smile at each other. The smiling woman wears an orange robe with a black stole.
The smiling woman lifts Madonna and tosses her back to the sky.
Madonna kisses the toes of the Jesus statue.
She looks up and holds the bars that separate her from the statue. She is surrounded in a warm, orange glow.
She opens the gate, reaches up, and touches Jesus's face.
The Black Jesus Statue drops the roses he's holding.
He looks down at her and places a hand on her shoulder
He whispers in her ear, then kisses her forehead.
She watches as he opens the door with the glowing orange windows. The door is labelled Exit.

Madonna looks down and sees a dagger lying with the roses. She picks it up, wraps her hand around the blade, winces, drops the blade, and looks at her hands. Her palms each have a single, bloody hole the size of a nail head.
On the dais, a black choir sings and dances.
The smiling woman is in the front row of the choir. Children dressed in white sway and clap.
In a flashback, Madonna walks out a door. She sees a woman walking. The gaunt man drops from the roof of a nearby building and grabs the woman. Ruffians approach and press the woman against a wall.
The choir sings
The woman grabs her side and screams.
Madonna and the gaunt man exchange glances.
A black man runs down a staircase
The choir sings. The woman falls to the ground.
The man reaches the woman. She doesn't move. A spotlight appears on him, the dead woman in his arms.
The ruffians run away
Policemen grab the black man. The dead woman slips from his arms to the ground. Madonna watches from the shadows.
The gaunt man watches her
The police cuff the black man. Madonna dances on a hill in front of burning crosses.
She wears a cross necklace that glitters black.
She crosses her arms and runs her hands up her shoulders. Her cross necklace rests her cleavage.
The straps of her negligee slide, revealing a black lacy bra against her white skin.
She runs her hands through her hair
The choir sings.
A boy gestures forward, and Madonna sings and dances with the choir.
The smiling woman approaches her, and they sing together.
A choir member plays a tamborine.
The black man looks down, softly. He's surrounded by warm candles.
Madonna rolls onto her back, surrounded by candles.
The smiling woman sings and places her palm on Madonna's forehead. Madonna dances to her knees before the woman.
Madonna, surrounded by candles, looks up at the black man. He looks down softly, and their lips draw close.
They kiss
Crosses burn.
Black Jesus Statue cry tears of blood
On the dais, Madonna dances with the smiling woman and the children.
The smiling woman has shoulder length curly hair with a side part. Madonna's hair is the same length, so they look similar while both women shake their heads and dance.
Madonna pats the head of the young boy.
The Black Jesus Statue looks down.
The choir proceeds from the dais
The gate closes behind Jesus
Madonna, lying on a bench, opens her eyes.
She looks around at the proceeding choir.
She turns towards the statue
The black man, behind bars, watches Madonna talking to a police officer.
She walks to the jail cell, and the police officer follows with keys.
The police station has a dais with chairs and a bench.
A curtain falls on the scene.
Madonna dances in front of burning crosses, running her hands through her hair.
The curtain rises. The cops, choir, ruffians, dead woman, and gaunt man bow.
They stand, the smiling woman in the middle.
Madonna and the black man run to the front of the stage, holding hands, and bow
The cast dances
The curtain falls. Text appears. The End.
